attributes.action: re-open the debate on a European Referendum, as outlined in a previous manifesto pledge , which promised that his party would give Britain a referundum on Europe, enabling  British voters the chance to vote on issues such as  the European Constitution and the Lisbon treaty , as had been conducted by the Irish Parliment for Irish voters.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: a european referundum would enable british voters a chance to say yes or no to the terms of the european consitution on matters concerning social policy, law, the armed forces, agricultural policies and more power given over to the european parliament. this petition is asking the prime minister to open a further debate on the issue and give british citizens, as has been done in other european countries, the chance to openly vote on the european consititution.
